name: 黃盈庭
objective: The applications of power electronics include electric vehicles, lighting, power systems, transportation, etc. The goal of this course is to help students understand the basic principles of power electronics and to integrate the comprehensive applications of electronic, circuit, and electromagnetic disciplines.
schedule:
Week 1：Introduction of power electronics
Week 2：Passive components (wire, resistor, capacitor, inductor, transformer)
Week 3：Switching devices (diode, transistor, FET, IGBT, SiC, GaN)
Week 4：Description of converter circuit topologies
Week 5：Principle and design of buck converter
Week 6：SIMPLIS simulation software (buck converter)
Week 7：Principle and design of boost converter
Week 8：Principle and design of buck-boost converter
Week 9：Midterm exam
Week 10：Principle and design of flyback converter
Week 11：SIMPLIS simulation software (flyback converter)
Week 12：Principle and design of forward converter
Week 13：Principle and design of cuk converter
Week 14：Loss analysis of the power converters
Week 15：State-space average method
Week 16：Circuit design of the feedback compensation controller
Week 17&18：Final report
scorePolicy:
Attendance & Performance：20%
Homework & Quizzes：20%
Midterm exam：30%
Final report：30%
materials:
1.Lecture notes
2.Power Electronics: Converters, Applications and Design (Mohan, Ned/ Undeland, Tore M./ Robbins, William P.)
consultation: There will be teaching assistant's consultation hours to allow students to ask questions after class. The professor can also be contacted via email to discuss the questions.
